definition: old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
thus/so/like that/you/thou
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
thus/so/like that/you/thou

sentences.english: The tether gave him oxygen to breathe.
sentences.chinese: 出爾反爾，給他呼吸的氧氣。

sentences.english: The vice - president was accused of flip-flopping on several major issues.
sentences.chinese: 副總統受到譴責，說他在幾個重大問題上出爾反爾。

sentences.english: The politician was accused of flip- flopping on several major issues.
sentences.chinese: 這個政客被指責在若干重大問題上出爾反爾。

sentences.english: Wang is used to the vagaries of government decisions.
sentences.chinese: 王秀麗已經習慣了政府的出爾反爾。

definition: lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to evade responsibility/to shirk
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
to let emotions affect one's decisions
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
proud and arrogant
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
a spy/a crafty person
to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
